name: Colgate Sensitive Complete Protection Toothpaste, 6 oz

reviews.name: Colgate Sensitive Complete Protection Toothpaste, 6 oz
reviews.reviewText: I have tried several other toothpastes for the sensitive mouth and nothing comes close to this one . I love the clean feel and fresh taste that this toothpaste leaves. It also gently whitens the teeth. Other toothpastes have irritated the inside of my mouth and didn't taste very good. I was pleasantly surprised by this one. I'm going to order more and stock up on it. I don't want to run out of this one. Try it. You will be happy you did.
reviews.title: Great Toothpaste !!!!!

reviews.name: Colgate Sensitive Complete Protection Toothpaste, 6 oz
reviews.reviewText: The left side of my mouth had start giving me problems so I decided to use this one instead of the more expensive sensodyne and it works great, it took about a week or so and that pain and sensitivity went away and I have continued to use this and I love it and I have notice I get even more people commenting me on my teeth saying how white they are, so I will stay with this I love it love it
reviews.title: Great!!!

reviews.name: Colgate Sensitive Complete Protection Toothpaste, 6 oz
reviews.reviewText:
I've been using Colgate Sensitive Multiprotection for a few years now, and I love it. It's a little bit gritty, i.e. abrasive, which gives that clean feeling to your teeth. And the taste is great, much like some of the older Colgate Toothpaste products.

But recently, I haven't been finding it in the stores. So, I went on-line to Walmart.com, and there it was. So, I ordered a bunch. But when it arrived on my doorstep, it wasn't the same product. It's now called Colgate Sensitive Complete Protection. And while the UPC number is the same as the old one, the product is not the same. It's less gritty and the taste isn't as good.

Why do companies do this? You have a product that might not be selling as well as you like, so some genius brand manager decides to change it under the logic of "new and improved". But the reality is that your small loyal core leaves and not enough new people start to buy it. End result? Product dies! I've seen this movie too many times before. And it always ends the same way.

Unless you bring back the original, you certainly lost me!
reviews.title: Not the Same

reviews.name: Colgate Sensitive Complete Protection Toothpaste, 6 oz
reviews.reviewText: If you have sensitive teeth and want whiter teeth this is the toothpaste you need. Plus, it has a great flavor. Very satisfied.
reviews.title: Very Good Product

reviews.name: Colgate Sensitive Complete Protection Toothpaste, 6 oz
reviews.reviewText: Used Crest for years but now switching to Colgate as this works well. It has the same amount of ingredients used for sensitivity and has fluoride etc to whiten. For the price it works way better in my opinion that crest. Don't be fooled by expensive brands and multiple types, because then all have the legal amount of fluoride to use and same active ingredients.
reviews.title: 1 Colgate Sensitive Multiprotection Toothpaste,
